intro: Calycogonium ramosissimum, commonly known as the branched calycogonium, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant is characterized by its sprawling growth habit and hairy, lobed leaves. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. The fruit is a small, round, green berry that ripens to a yellowish color.
